title: Snow Day and 5th Grade Concert Recap
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content: We had our first snow day this week! What a nice surprise! Please make sure your phone number and email address are up to date on Final Forms so you will not miss any cancellation calls. 5th grade put on a wonderful performance Wednesday evening at their concert! They definitely brought the holiday spirit! Have a great weekend!

summary: The school had its first snow day this week. **Parents should update their phone numbers and email addresses on Final Forms** to ensure they receive cancellation notifications. The 5th grade performed a holiday concert on Wednesday evening that brought great holiday spirit.

title: Upper Lot Parking Policy Enforcement
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
*PARKING 

REMINDER*

*PARKING REMINDER*

We know the weather is getting colder and it is covenient to park in the upper lot and wait for your student. However, this lot is reserved for staff and Preschool pick up ONLY. Starting MONDAY 12/8, the only vehicles we will be allowing in the upper lot at drop off and pick up will be those with the orange PRESCHOOL sheet in the window.This is to ensure the safety of our students that are walkers and foot pick up as well as our bus riders. We are seeing a large number of cars parking in the upper lot or blocking the busses which is causing traffic flow issuesWe appreciate your cooperation!If you have any questions or concerns, please call the office! We are happy to help!

summary: Starting **Monday, December 8th**, the upper parking lot will be **restricted to staff and preschool families only** during drop-off and pick-up times. Only vehicles displaying the **orange PRESCHOOL sheet** will be allowed in the upper lot. This change ensures safety for walking students, foot pick-ups, and bus riders, and addresses traffic flow issues caused by cars blocking buses. Contact the office with questions.

event_info.title: Upper Lot Parking Restriction Begins
event_info.description: Starting **Monday, December 8th**, the upper parking lot will be **restricted to staff and preschool families only** during drop-off and pick-up times. Only vehicles displaying the **orange PRESCHOOL

title: PTG Community Updates and Fundraisers
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
zoom_out_map
            
The Oxford Lions Club Sight Saving Committee is collecting used eyeglasses (including sunglasses), as well as glasses cases! These glasses and cases are donated all over the world to children who are in need. The lenses and frames from the donated glasses are modified to meet individual children's eye needs. Every year, Oxford Lions Club collects and sends 900-plus pairs of glasses to children in need!Please send any glasses donations to Betsy Beaton (Marshall Elementary School) or Shaunna Tafelski (Board Office) by the beginning of December. We are happy to swing by and pick up glasses donations or they can be dropped off at Marshall or the Board Office. Thank you for supporting the Oxford Lions Club! :)

*PTG*

*PTG*

HOLIDAY 

SHOP

HOLIDAY SHOP

Kramer PTG Holiday Shop:The Holiday Shop is a fun and exciting community building event hosted by Kramer PTG for our students. It‚Äôs always a highlight of the season, and the kids are thrilled to shop for special gifts for their family, friends, and pets!Holiday Shop will be December 15th & 16th during school hours. Students will have the opportunity to shop each day with their class.Items will cost $2.00 each. Please send all money to school in a Zip-loc bag or envelope clearly labeled with the student's name and teacher. Cash preferred‚Äîwe will have change.  Also accepting Checks made out to ‚ÄúKramer PTG‚ÄùShop Workers are needed to help students pick out presents and run the shop. We also need volunteers to help set up before school and clean up immediately following dismissal. If you are interested in volunteer, please sign up below: https://tinyurl.com/KramerHS25

zoom_out_map
            
Read At Home
Attention Kindergarten, 1st, and 2nd grade families: RAH begins on Wednesday September 24th. This will be our first reward day, so please return your RAH sheet by Wednesday!Kramer RAH (Reading At Home) is a voluntary program from K-2nd graders that builds a home-school connection by rewarding students for reading at home. Each week students record the books they've read and turn-in record sheets for rewards. Rewards alternate between a student selected book and a small prize.

zoom_out_map
            
Have you connected your Kroger Rewards card to the Kramer PTG yet? Each account can be connected to ONE nonprofit. When you use this feature, Kroger donates a percentage of your expenses to our PTG. You just have to sign up once! https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards

summary:
**Oxford Lions Club Eyeglass Drive**: Donate used eyeglasses, sunglasses, and cases to help children in need worldwide. Drop off at Marshall Elementary (Betsy Beaton) or Board Office (Shaunna Tafelski) by early December.

**Kramer Holiday Shop** (Dec 15-16): Students shop for $2 gifts for family and friends during school hours. Send money in labeled Zip-loc bag/envelope to teacher. Volunteers needed: https://tinyurl.com/KramerHS25

**Read At Home (RAH) Program**: K-2nd graders record books read at home weekly for rewards (alternating between books and prizes). First reward day is Wednesday, September 24th.

**Kroger Rewards**: Link your Kroger card to Kramer PTG once to donate a percentage of purchases automatically: https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards

summary: The Community Page highlights local resources and upcoming school events. **PUSH (People United for Self Help)** provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical home repairs‚Äîcall 513-523-8100 or visit http://www.push-oxford.org/. Additional community events include the **Talawanda Baseball Winter Clinic** (Jan 18-19, 9:00-11:00 AM at THS Gymnasium, $30-50), **Science of Snowflakes** event at Oxford Lane Library (Dec 13, 11:00 AM-12:00 PM), **Cincinnati Youth Choir Vivo Coro** (Thursdays 6:00-7:00 PM for grades 3-6), **English Language Caf√©** at Miami University (Tuesdays 6-7 PM starting Sept 16), and **Bus Driver positions** available with Petermann Transportation (starting at $20/hr, call 513-273-3150). The school calendar includes Winter Break (Dec 22-Jan 6), Mother/Son Dance (Jan 31), Spring Break (March 30-April 6), Field Day (May 8), and last day of school (May 21).

title: Talawanda Food Pantry and Resources Available
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
TALAWANDA 

FOOD 

RESOURCES

TALAWANDA FOOD RESOURCES

KRAMER FREE PANTRY
The food pantry in front of Kramer is stocked! Please take any items you may need for your family. Talawanda has many resources available to help in a time of need. Please contact Chelsea Pike at 513-273-3511 for any needs you or your family may have.If you would like to donate to the pantry, contact Chelsea or drop off donations to the Kramer office.

OTHER TALAWANDA FREE RESOURCES
SEE IMAGES BELOW FOR MORE INFORMATION

zoom_out_map
                








zoom_out_map

summary: The **Kramer Free Pantry** located at the entrance of Kramer is stocked with free food and hygiene items for all students, including cereal, fruit, veggies, peanut butter, spaghetti, mac and cheese, soup, shampoo, and toothbrushes. Students can take what they need, and donations can be dropped off at the Kramer office. For questions, donations, or additional family needs, contact **Chelsea Pike, Kramer Social Worker** at **513-273-3511** or **pikec@talawanda.org**.

title: Student Thanksgiving Turkey Art Display
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
Friday 

November 

21, 

2025

Friday November 21, 2025

summary: A large collaborative turkey decoration is displayed in the school, featuring a brown paper body with googly eyes and yellow beak and feet. The turkey's tail feathers consist of hundreds of colorful, hand-decorated paper feathers created by students, each filled with drawings, patterns, and writing, spreading across the wall in a vibrant display of student creativity for the Thanksgiving season.

title: Thanksgiving Break and PAX Leaders
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content: Have a Happy Thanksgiving! We are so thankful for all of our Kramer kiddos and families! Enjoy the week off!Students return Monday December 1st.

summary:
Kramer Elementary wishes families a Happy Thanksgiving! **Students are off for Thanksgiving break and return Monday, December 1st.** 

This week's **Kramer PAX Leaders** (Good Behavior Game) are:
- **KG:** Otis Cherry, An'an Dong, Shep Kleibscheidel, Sophia Smith
- **1st:** Bryce Richardson, Vivienne Smiley, Dylan Wyatt

title: PTG Meeting Rescheduled & Community Updates
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
zoom_out_map
            
The Oxford Lions Club Sight Saving Committee is collecting used eyeglasses (including sunglasses), as well as glasses cases! These glasses and cases are donated all over the world to children who are in need. The lenses and frames from the donated glasses are modified to meet individual children's eye needs. Every year, Oxford Lions Club collects and sends 900-plus pairs of glasses to children in need!Please send any glasses donations to Betsy Beaton (Marshall Elementary School) or Shaunna Tafelski (Board Office) by the beginning of December. We are happy to swing by and pick up glasses donations or they can be dropped off at Marshall or the Board Office. Thank you for supporting the Oxford Lions Club! :)

*PTG*

*PTG*

Please note that the November 18th PTG meeting is being RESCHEDULED to Tuesday, December 2nd at 7 pm (virtual meeting). This move allows interested members to attend the November 18th seminar titled "Building a Tech Healthy Household" in the THS auditorium from 6 to 7:30 pm. Thank you for your patience!

zoom_out_map
            
Read At Home
Attention Kindergarten, 1st, and 2nd grade families: RAH begins on Wednesday September 24th. This will be our first reward day, so please return your RAH sheet by Wednesday!Kramer RAH (Reading At Home) is a voluntary program from K-2nd graders that builds a home-school connection by rewarding students for reading at home. Each week students record the books they've read and turn-in record sheets for rewards. Rewards alternate between a student selected book and a small prize.

zoom_out_map
            
Have you connected your Kroger Rewards card to the Kramer PTG yet? Each account can be connected to ONE nonprofit. When you use this feature, Kroger donates a percentage of your expenses to our PTG. You just have to sign up once! https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards

summary: The **November 18th PTG meeting has been rescheduled to Tuesday, December 2nd at 7 PM** (virtual meeting) to allow members to attend the "Building a Tech Healthy Household" seminar on November 18th. Additional updates include: Oxford Lions Club is collecting used eyeglasses and cases (donations due early December to Betsy Beaton or Shaunna Tafelski), **Read At Home (RAH) program for K-2nd graders begins September 24th** with the first reward day, and families are encouraged to **link Kroger Rewards cards to Kramer PTG** at https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards.

summary:
**Community Resources:** PUSH (People United for Self Help) provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. Contact Jeanne or Sabrina at 513-523-8100 or visit http://www.push-oxford.org/. Additional community events include the **Cincinnati Youth Choir** (Vivo Coro Oxford, grades 3-6, Thursdays 6:00-7:00 PM at Miami University), **English Language Caf√©** at Miami University (Tuesdays 6-7 PM starting September 16 in MacMillan Hall Room 017), and **Petermann Transportation** hiring bus drivers (must be 21+, starting pay $20/hr, call 513-273-3150).

**Upcoming School Events:** Key dates include PTG meetings, grade-level music concerts, K-Kids meetings, winter break (12/22-1/6), Mother/Son Dance, spring break (3/30-4/6), Field Day (5/8), and last day of school (5/21).

summary: Support Kramer Elementary families this holiday season by purchasing gifts from their **Amazon Wishlist**. Every gift goes directly to a Kramer student or family in need of extra support. For questions or if your family needs holiday assistance, contact Chelsea Pike at **pikec@talawanda.org**. [Shop the wishlist here](https://www.amazon.com/hz/wishlist/ls/20IM1FE5Z3VJ2?ref_=wl_share).

title: Weekly PAX Leaders Highlighted at Kramer
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content: Great things happening at Kramer again! This week we start highlighting our PAX classroom leaders. Every week we will feature new leaders. See the PAX section below to see what we are working on the next two months.One more week till Thanksgiving break! Have a great weekend!

summary:
Kramer Elementary begins a new weekly feature highlighting **PAX classroom leaders**. This week's leaders include:
- **KG**: Amelia Chen, Lorelai Dougherty, Hannah Neim, Josue Perez Gomes
- **1st Grade**: Caroline Butler, Cora King, Hunter Stewart, Oscar Villanueva-Fuentes
- **2nd Grade**: Charles Hricko, Lucy Ransdell, Avery Reece, Aiden Todd
- **3rd Grade**: Kendall Gloyeske, Lucian Miller, Keyla Perez Gomez, Audrey Ream
- **4th Grade**: Abby Bulanda, Luke Hricko, Liam Morrow, Levi Smith
- **5th Grade**: Sonia Clark, Alyssa Martinez

**Thanksgiving break** is November 24-28. Other upcoming events include no school on November 4 (voting day), 3rd Grade STEM day at Miami on November 7, 4th Grade Music Concert on November 12 at 7:00, Class @ the Court for grades 3-5 on November 13 (PTG Dine to Donate at Logrosa's), and report cards sent home November 14.

11/19......K-Kids11/24......28 NO SCHOOL (THANKSGIVING BREAK)12/2....PTG MEETNG 7:00 (VIRTUAL)12/3......5TH GRADE MUSIC CONCERT12/10......K-Kids12/19.......5TH GRADE TO NUTCRACKER BALLET12/22 -1/6......NO SCHOOL (WINTER BREAK)1/19......NO SCHOOL 1/21......K-Kids1/23......PTG MEETING (VIRTUAL)1/31......MOTHER/SON DANCE 6-82/16......NO SCHOOL2/18......K-Kids2/20.......END OF 2ND TRIMESTER2/25......3RD GRADE MUSIC CONCERT2/28......KRAMER KIDS SKATE3/3......PTG MEETING3/10......2ND GRADE MUSIC CONCERT3/12......CONFERENCES3/17......CONFERENCES3/18......K-Kids3/30 - 4/6......NO SCHOOL (SPRING BREAK)4/15......K-Kids4/28......PTG MEETING5/4......NO SCHOOL (DATA DAY)5/5......NO SCHOOL (PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT)5/8......FIELD DAY5/13......K-Kids5/21......LAST DAY

summary:
The **Community Page** features local resources and upcoming school events. **PUSH** (People United for Self Help) provides grants for home repairs to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District‚Äîcall 513-523-8100 or visit http://www.push-oxford.org/. The calendar includes key dates through May, such as **Thanksgiving Break (Nov 24-28)**, **Winter Break (Dec 22-Jan 6)**, **Spring Break (March 30-April 6)**, and various K-Kids meetings, music concerts, and family events like the Mother/Son Dance and Field Day.

Additional community opportunities include a **shoe donation drive** for 4Paws for Ability (collection until December 1st, accepting all styles/sizes), **Cincinnati Youth Choir's Vivo Coro Oxford** for grades 3-6 (Thursdays 6:00-7:00 PM at Miami University), **English Language Caf√©** at Miami University (Tuesdays 6-7 PM starting September 16 in MacMillan Hall Room 017), and **bus driver positions** with Petermann Transportation ($20/hr starting pay, call 513-273-3150).

title: Kramer Free Pantry and Food Resources
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
TALAWANDA 

FOOD 

RESOURCES

TALAWANDA FOOD RESOURCES

KRAMER FREE PANTRY
The food pantry in front of Kramer is stocked! Please take any items you may need for your family. Talawanda has many resources available to help in a time of need. Please contact Chelsea Pike at 513-273-3511 for any needs you or your family may have.If you would like to donate to the pantry, contact Chelsea or drop off donations to the Kramer office.

OTHER TALAWANDA FREE RESOURCES
SEE IMAGES BELOW FOR MORE INFORMATION

zoom_out_map
                








zoom_out_map

summary: The **Kramer Free Pantry** at the entrance of Kramer is stocked with food and hygiene items including cereal, fruit, veggies, peanut butter, spaghetti, mac and cheese, soup, shampoo, and toothbrushes‚Äîavailable to all students and families in need. Contact **Chelsea Pike** at **513-273-3511** or **pikec@talawanda.org** for questions, donations, or to learn about other Talawanda food resources. Donations can be dropped off at the Kramer office.

title: PTG Meeting Rescheduled and Community Updates
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
zoom_out_map
            
The Oxford Lions Club Sight Saving Committee is collecting used eyeglasses (including sunglasses), as well as glasses cases! These glasses and cases are donated all over the world to children who are in need. The lenses and frames from the donated glasses are modified to meet individual children's eye needs. Every year, Oxford Lions Club collects and sends 900-plus pairs of glasses to children in need!Please send any glasses donations to Betsy Beaton (Marshall Elementary School) or Shaunna Tafelski (Board Office) by the beginning of December. We are happy to swing by and pick up glasses donations or they can be dropped off at Marshall or the Board Office. Thank you for supporting the Oxford Lions Club! :)

*PTG*

*PTG*

Please note that the November 18th PTG meeting is being RESCHEDULED to Tuesday, December 2nd at 7 pm (virtual meeting). This move allows interested members to attend the November 18th seminar titled "Building a Tech Healthy Household" in the THS auditorium from 6 to 7:30 pm. Thank you for your patience!

KRAMER 

LOST 

& 

FOUND

KRAMER LOST & FOUND

zoom_out_map
                








zoom_out_map
                








zoom_out_map

zoom_out_map
            
Read At Home
Attention Kindergarten, 1st, and 2nd grade families: RAH begins on Wednesday September 24th. This will be our first reward day, so please return your RAH sheet by Wednesday!Kramer RAH (Reading At Home) is a voluntary program from K-2nd graders that builds a home-school connection by rewarding students for reading at home. Each week students record the books they've read and turn-in record sheets for rewards. Rewards alternate between a student selected book and a small prize.

zoom_out_map
            
Have you connected your Kroger Rewards card to the Kramer PTG yet? Each account can be connected to ONE nonprofit. When you use this feature, Kroger donates a percentage of your expenses to our PTG. You just have to sign up once! https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards

summary: The November 18th PTG meeting has been **rescheduled to Tuesday, December 2nd at 7 PM** (virtual meeting). This allows members to attend the "Building a Tech Healthy Household" seminar on November 18th from 6-7:30 PM in the THS auditorium. Additional updates include: Oxford Lions Club collecting used eyeglasses and cases (donations to Betsy Beaton or Shaunna Tafelski by early December), Kramer RAH (Reading At Home) program starting September 24th for K-2nd graders, and a reminder to connect Kroger Rewards cards to Kramer PTG at **https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards**.

title: November Lunch Menu Available
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
*NOVEMBER 

LUNCH 

MENU*

*NOVEMBER LUNCH MENU*

summary:
The **November 2025 lunch menu** for Kramer Elementary is now available. The menu includes daily meal options with a choice of milk included with every lunch. Notable menu items include:
- **November 3-7**: Fish Sandwich, Beef Pretzel Dog, National Nacho Day (Nov 6), 4x6 Rectangle Cheese Pizza
- **November 10-14**: Chicken Patty on Bun, Hot Breaded Mozzarella Sticks, Chicken Alfredo, Chicken Tenders Dinner Roll, Wild Mike's Cheese Bites
- **November 17-21**: Mini Corn Dogs, Holiday Meal with Roast Turkey and Gravy (Nov 18), Bosco Sticks, Galaxy Personal Pan Pizza Turkey Pepperoni, Pillsbury Cheese Pull Apart Bread
- **November 24-28**: No school for Thanksgiving Break (Nov 24-28)

All meals include vegetables, fruits, and sides. Menu is subject to change based on product availability.

summary:
This page highlights **community resources and upcoming school events**. Key community offerings include:
- **PUSH** provides home repair grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District (call 513-523-8100)
- **Veterans Day Breakfast & Assembly** on November 11, 2025 at Talawanda High School (7:30 AM breakfast, 9:00 AM assembly) - RSVP to croucherk@talawanda.org
- **Shoe donation drive** through December 1st benefiting 4Paws for Ability
- **Cincinnati Youth Choir (Vivo Coro)** meets Thursdays 6:00-7:00 PM at Miami University for grades 3-6
- **English Language Caf√©** at Miami University, Tuesdays 6-7 PM in MacMillan Hall Room 017
- **Bus driver positions** available with Petermann Transportation ($20/hr starting pay)

The calendar includes numerous school events through May, including trimester endings, concerts, conferences, and special events.

title: Halloween Celebration and Lost and Found
source_title: Kramer Elementary | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
zoom_out_map
            
Happy Halloween!What an interesting week at Kramer Elementary! You could tell the kids were ready to celebrate today. Thank you to all of our parents and volunteers who came in to help with class parties and view our parade!Please see the PTG section below regarding our lost and found. We have accumulated quite the pile! Check the pictures below or come in to the office to see if anything belongs to your student. Anything left after Thanksgiving break will be donated.** NO SCHOOL TUESDAY 11/4 FOR ELECTION DAY**We hope everyone has a great weekend!

summary: Kramer Elementary celebrated Halloween with class parties and a costume parade. **No school on Tuesday, November 4th for Election Day.** The school has accumulated a large lost and found collection - parents should check the office or photos to claim items. **All unclaimed items will be donated after Thanksgiving break (November 24-28).** Thank you to parent volunteers who helped with celebrations.

event_info.title: No School - Election Day
event_info.description: Kramer Elementary celebrated Halloween with class parties and a costume parade. **No school on Tuesday, November 4th for Election Day.** The school has accumulated a large lost and found collection -

title: Unplug and Play Event at Kramer

and 

Play 

Event 

- 

11/5/2025

Unplug and Play Event - 11/5/2025
Mark your calendar for this fun event planned by our Unplug and Play group!

*PTG*

*PTG*

KRAMER 

LOST 

& 

FOUND

Read At Home
Attention Kindergarten, 1st, and 2nd grade families: RAH begins on Wednesday September 24th. This will be our first reward day, so please return your RAH sheet by Wednesday!Kramer RAH (Reading At Home) is a voluntary program from K-2nd graders that builds a home-school connection by rewarding students for reading at home. Each week students record the books they've read and turn-in record sheets for rewards. Rewards alternate between a student selected book and a small prize.

Have you connected your Kroger Rewards card to the Kramer PTG yet? Each account can be connected to ONE nonprofit. When you use this feature, Kroger donates a percentage of your expenses to our PTG. You just have to sign up once! https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards

summary:
**Unplug & Play Kramer - Flashlight Fun at Dusk** on **Wednesday, November 5, 5:30-7:00 PM** at Kramer playground. Bring a lawn chair and relax while kids engage in independent creative play with flashlights. Parents and staff can chat while children play unplugged.

Additional updates: **Kramer PTG Meeting** on Tuesday, December 2 at 7 PM (virtual - parents and teachers encouraged to attend); **LaRosa's Pizza Fundraiser** on Thursday, November 13, 4 PM-close (dine in, delivery, pickup - lunch delivery included, must note Kramer on receipt); **Read At Home (RAH) program** for K-2nd graders begins Wednesday, September 24th; **Kroger Community Rewards** - link your card to Kramer PTG at https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards.
